Articles.Content:
The FTE-600 has no real purpose, however I find it quite entertaining to try to shoot some of the debris that slowly begin to accumulate around KSC.

It is mainly supposed to look cool and fly well, but as I said, useful for getting rid of debris.

Things to take note of:

-It has a functioning abort system (tied to the abort action group.)

-The missiles tend to follow exactly prograde, not where you are pointing.

-70 m/s is takeoff velocity.

-Don't pull up too rapidly on takeoff, you could clip off the entire tail (s.)

Download:

http://tinyurl.com/clms74h

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

The FTE-600 B is a bit more clunky, however better with gliding with a larger wingspan. It is a little better with long range flight with less throttle needed to keep it up in the air. I also prefer it for airstrikes because of the larger amount of drag, adding up to better deceleration.

Download link: http://tinyurl.com/kpq2scf

Edited June 21, 2013 by HQtopgun1

It's certainly... unique. Don't think I've seen a tailplane like that before. What the heck, I'll stick it in my hangar. Looks pretty sweet. I'll have to put those missiles through their paces for sure.
Because this design was a (minor) success, I'm starting construction on the FTE-600 B.
